abstract: Magnum, the Trojan subbrand of large condoms, is undertaking its first advertising campaign, called the Magnum Live Large Project, which features the rapper Ludacris.
snippet: Magnum, the Trojan subbrand of large condoms, is undertaking its first advertising campaign, called the Magnum Live Large Project, which features the rapper Ludacris.
lead_paragraph: MAGNUM, the Trojan subbrand of large condoms, has climbed steadily from a 4.6 percent share of the condom market in 2001 to an 18.8 percent share today, according to the SymphonyIRI Group, a research firm whose data does not include Wal-Mart. What may strike some on Madison Avenue as more remarkable than that growth, however, is that although Trojan has been widely advertised, parent company Church & Dwight has never advertised Magnum specifically.

headline.main: A Hip-Hop Contest to Promote a Brand
headline.print_headline: A Hip-Hop Contest to Promote a Brand
